meanings.definition: To believe in the truth or existence of something.
meanings.sent1: She was crediting the story her friend told her.
meanings.sent2: I am crediting the fact that the sun rises every morning.
meanings.sent3: The detective was crediting the suspect's alibi with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was crediting the strange noise to a ghostly presence.
meanings.sent5: Crediting the map, he confidently led the group through the forest.

meanings.definition: To acknowledge a contribution or achievement.
meanings.sent1: He was crediting his team for the successful project.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is crediting the students for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was crediting the audience's laughter to his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The coach was crediting the team's victory to their dedication.
meanings.sent5: Crediting her mentor, she proudly displayed her award.

meanings.definition: To add money to an account.
meanings.sent1: The bank is crediting your account with the deposit.
meanings.sent2: I will be crediting your account with the refund shortly.
meanings.sent3: Crediting the account with interest, the bank helped the savings grow.
meanings.sent4: The company was crediting the employee's salary for the overtime worked.
meanings.sent5: She was crediting her account to save up for a vacation.
